summary: Add a basement in Breezehome:  Every workbench you need, 25 new containers, a merchant sell everything, and a bed...
descriptionHtml:
If you are from Asia or can read Chinese, you can come [url=http://forum.gamer.com.tw/Co.php?bsn=02526&sn=56984]here[/url] to find an other download site.

[color=red][what\'s new in V2.1?][/color]
[list]
[*]-Add a room in the basement, 7 new containers and a bed in the room.
[*]-[b]Each workbench has the number of containers are increased[/b]:
 Alchemy: 5
 Enchant: 3
 Workbench & TanningRack: 5
 Smelter & Forge: 3
[*]-Blacksmith now been changed to the merchant, [b]will sell anything:Soul gem, Enchant type,  Ore, Fur and All alchemical materials. also, gold increased to 10000.[/b]
[*]-That wardrobe in the player\'s room.The 2 drawers can be used independently now. (basement\'s wardrobe also)
[*]-Improve fog
[/list]
To install or update, you still need to read the instructions below, otherwise cause the Items lost or Game crashes, are not my accountability.

[b][Description][/b]
[list]
[*]-Every workbench you need are all inside. 
[*]-There are 3~5 containers near each tools.[color=red](V2.1 improvements, view photo.)[/color]
[*]-A merchant nearby. 24-hour, won\'t move, 10000 gold, sell everything.[color=red](V2.1 improvements)[/color]
[*]-An export direct access to the Whiterun in basement.(Requires Breezehome\'s key outside)
[*]-Player\'s bedroom add 4 containers.[color=red](V2.1 improvements)[/color]
[*]-Your follower or partner can enter this area.
[*]-Can travel to Breezehome.(Optional)
[*]-FOUR VERSIONS
[/list]

[b][Versions Description][/b]
[list]
[*]-Normal: Need to purchase, have MapMarker.
[*]-No MapMarker: Need to purchase, No MapMarker.
[*]-Non-purchased: Dont need to purchase, have MapMarker.
[*]-Non-purchased No MapMarker: Dont need to purchase, No MapMarker.
[/list]

[color=red][b]##NOTE##[/b][/color]
If you already purchased all projects, than I suggest you use \"Not purchased Versions\" for good.
Otherwise, I recommend you use \"Normal Version\", you can observe the changes before and after the purchase.


[b][Installation][/b]
[list=1]
[*]1.Before you do this save a new save OUTSIDE Breezehome.
[*]2.Go to \"\\...\\The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim\\Data\" and drop the .esp File into it.
[*]3.Activate mod and load that new save.
[/list] 

[b][Update][/b]
[color=red][b]##NOTE##[/b][/color]
whether you are using the purchase or non-purchase version in V2.0,  please use the non-purchase version in V2.1.
[list=1]
[*]1.Take all your stuff with you in the basement & player\'s room. Then go out and save a game archive.
[*]2.Close the Game.
[*]3.Uninstall v2.0 in NMM or SkyrimLauncher.
[*]4.Open Game and load the archive in step 1.
[*]5.Save another new archive.
[*]6.Remove(or coverage) the old ESP file. And put new esp into the folder.
[*]7.Check v2.1 in NMM or SkyrimLauncher. and load the archive in step 5.
[/list] 

[b][Bugs happened and How to fix][/b]

-If you already purchased all projects and you used \"Normal Version\", may happened   something or someone disappeared in the basement. to fix it, use \"Not purchased Versions\".

-If you can\'t find NPC at fist time, close the game and load the save OUTSIDE Breezehome.
 or use \"Not purchased Versions\".

-If one day you back to home can\'t find NPC, close the game and load the save OUTSIDE   Breezehome.

-If you purchased all projects still cant find any tools in basement, use \"Not purchased   Versions\"

-If fist time you use this mod and those furniture  are not on the  position, close the game   and load the save OUTSIDE  Breezehome.
author: heyosteve

files.name: Steves Breezehome_Not purchased No MapMarker V2
